Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2008 02:19PM Annaswe wrote: A year ago I found out I had a brain met and I thought it was the end of the story. I had radiation (10) and I´m still hanging around. Hopefully it´s still shrinking. Anna

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2008 09:00AM Annaswe wrote: Never heard of taking zometa as a pill. I had zometa for 6 years as a monthly infusion. Never had any sideeffects but my doctor took me off zometa this summer. Now I take bondronate daily and I have to wait half an hour before I can eat or drink, only water is allowed. Zometa is a very powerful drug the doctors say so it´s intresting this new trial. Anna

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2008 10:12AM Annaswe wrote: I found out my mets 8 years ago, bone, liver and lungs. After chemo, and radiation I started with zometa and tamoxifen. It kept me stable until last year. Now I`m on arimidix and bondronate (pills) instead of zometa. Zometa works very well bur my onc took me off this drog, he was afraid of sideeffects after having it so long. After having mets in the area of my right hip for 8 years I now need surgery but the doctors don´t now if its possible. Anna from Sweden

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2008 03:34PM Annaswe wrote: Nancy! radiation can work very well. I have lots of mets in my hip and pelvis. I had radiation several times during 8 years. It stopped the pain right away and it stopped the mets to grow too. You say you have microscopic cancer so maybe the radiation can take away the cancer for good! My mets cant be cured, they are all over. At least the radiation stopped them from growing. I´m on hormonal therapy too. Hope this threatment can help you Anna

Posts.Title: Brain Scan Results: Not Good TripleNeg cneal318

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2008 05:50PM Annaswe wrote: Hi, I think my story is positive in a way. Had an original dx in 1990, stage1, no nodes, mastectomy, no chemo. After 8 years I started to have back pain and pain in my right hip. It was nothing , only trouble with my back the doctors told me. For two years I was in pain more or less. They gave me painkillers but no scan. Finally I got an x-ray and at that time  I could hardly walk. It was the bc comming back. Mets all over, bones, lungs, liver. I had chemo, radiation and tamoxifen. aredia for my bones. Two years later the mets in lungs and liver was gone. I switched to zometa för my bones and had tamoxifen until 2007.Now Aredimix.Nothing new came up in my bones but last summer I found out I had a brain met. I had radiation for that and the tumor started to shrink. After having mets for 8 years in my hip and pelvis its totaly broken. I can hardly walk and my hip joint? ( sorry not sure if it´s the right word) has moved into my pelvis because its too weak. The doctors don`t know how to do anything about it. Please let me know if you heard about something similar. Áfter all, this is a positive story and I feel healthy and in a good mood but I need surgery . I would be very pleased if someone know anything about  this kind of operation. Thanks, Anna from Sweden
